snippet: In the first installment of federal aid, $648 million will go to programs to rebuild homes and make them more storm resistant.
abstract: Federal government approves New York City's plan to spend the first $1.77 billion in aid for Hurricane Sandy recovery, with money expected to start flowing by early summer to homeowners, businesses and others in need; biggest chunk of money, $648 million, will go to programs to rebuild homes and make them more storm-resistant.
lead_paragraph: In the first installment of federal aid, $648 million will go to programs to rebuild homes and make them more storm resistant.

headline.main: City to Begin Distributing Storm Aid This Summer
headline.print_headline: City to Begin Distributing Storm Aid This Summer
